itemDescription: RAF Air Vice-Marshal Arthur Stanley Gould Lee

wikipedia_page.main: Air Vice Marshal Arthur Stanley Gould Lee,  (31 August 1894 – 21 May 1975) was a senior officer of the Royal Air Force (RAF). He began his flying career in the Royal Flying Corps during the First World War, scoring seven confirmed victories to become a flying ace and rising to the rank of captain. He continued his service in the RAF, serving throughout the Second World War before retiring in 1946 to devote himself to writing, including several volumes of autobiography.
